reviewText: Not what I was looking for. This is more on different  techniques you can try to develope early skills then teaching formation and how the kid should stage hia or herself for the hit or catch.

It is okay.  there are a bunch of good ideas mixed in.  It is hard work to keep t-ball aged kids paying attention.  I wish there was more focus on how they throw, turn sideways and not just winging it to a ring.  Even bumping their thigh before they throw to get arm movement instead of pushing.  Last note- spoiler alert:  Do not expect your t-ball aged kid to be as good as the kids in this video, they are older kids performing t-ball drills.  It is okay as long as you are aware of your expectations.  I rented this from my library.
Glad it was rented and not bought.
Most of the drills are okay for parents to do with their little ones in the back yard.
Very good drills and explains stuff clearly.
My son loves to watch this. over an over.
Great video! I can use some of these drills with my son beyond T-ball and into Little League as well..
I chose this for my grandson hoping it could help him with his game.  He loves baseball so this was bought for him.
many excellent drills and advice to maintain a child's interest while developing baseball skills. We also liked the creative approaches used to make practice more fun.
